column4: has someone successfully compiled pcmcia-cs modules for a 2.6 kernel - or can tell me how to do that?
i need a driver that only exists as a patch to pcmcia-cs.
and i dont want to go back to 2.4
I'm not sure that pcmcia-cs works properly with the 2.6-series kernel..
I seem to remember reading in the documentation that a lot of the drivers aren't compilable for 2.6..
but I may be wrong, don't quote me on that; I'd check the pcmcia-cs documentation if I were you. That'll tell you either way, and if it's possible, it'll tell you how to compile them.
should be possible. i got latest source from the project homepage
but configuring it it told me to disable pcmcia support in kernel - so i did. then it told me to enable it in kernels newer than 2.5 :/
no it didn't :p
really? i used xmms when i never heard of gnome
mst gnome existed before the gnome project started
ok
just found that,too
hmm. kde vs gnome?
kde announcement in 96.
yeah, kde's older
because gnome was founded specifically because kde wasn't free :)
yeah. i remember that time. so it really is almost ten years i'm using linux now

I wasn't really aware of the founding of gnome, but I was certainly aware of the unfreeness of KDE in my first stages of using linux, so I would've started using linux for the first time shortly after then :)
I started out using DEC machines which were purloined from a skip :)
my first was linux. my first computing experiences were with a c64. i broke the floppy drives after a few weeks. couldn'T afford a new one. so i learned basic
took me a while from finding it good to have free software to finding it bad to have non-free software.
suse 6.2-6.3 time
